title: About me
text:
I am an applied micro-economist who studies health, management, productivity, and entrepreneurship.
My work in low- and middle-income countries focuses on designing and evaluating interventions that increase the human capital of individuals and firms.
In Mexico, my work relates to obesity and non-communicable diseases from the perspective of health services research and public policy.

title: Ongoing research
text:
Skills for Effective Entrepreneurship Development (SEED)
We study the effects of SEED, an in-residence three-week mini-MBA program for high-school students in Uganda with hard-skills and soft-skills arms. (Add abstract or bullet points; include links to NBER/CEPR/VoxDev pages as desired.)
